title: That the Council agenda be amended to include item 4c, regarding the Authority to Approve Patio License Extensions.

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CLSOCS23-002 dated March 13, 2023 of the City Solicitor as follows: That staff be authorized to proceed as outlined in Report CLSOCS23-002 dated March 13, 2023 of the City Solicitor respecting The Canadian Canoe Museum.

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CLSOCS23-002 dated March 13, 2023 of the City Solicitor as follows: That staff be authorized to proceed as outlined in Report CLSOCS23-002 dated March 13, 2023 of the City Solicitor respecting The Canadian Canoe Museum. That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CLSOCS23-003 dated March 13, 2023 of the City Solicitor as follows: That staff be authorized to proceed as outlined in Report CLSOCS23-003 dated March 13, 2023 of the City Solicitor respecting Trespass By-law 19-075.

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CLSOCS23-002 dated March 13, 2023 of the City Solicitor as follows: That staff be authorized to proceed as outlined in Report CLSOCS23-002 dated March 13, 2023 of the City Solicitor respecting The Canadian Canoe Museum. That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CLSOCS23-003 dated March 13, 2023 of the City Solicitor as follows: That staff be authorized to proceed as outlined in Report CLSOCS23-003 dated March 13, 2023 of the City Solicitor respecting Trespass By-law 19-075. Whereas, an Ontario business with an existing liquor license can apply to extend their licensed area to include an outdoor patio for up to a maximum of eight months per year and; Whereas, the Alcohol and Gamming Commission of Ontario or AGCO has transferred the responsibility to approved a patio extension to Ontario municipalities effective 2023. Be it Resolved, That the City Clerk is authorized to accept and approve applications for temporary outdoor physical extensions, subject to City Clerk’s satisfaction with compliance with any provincial regulations, City by-laws, policies and insurance requirements, until the April council meeting when a more fulsome report on the issue is forthcoming.
23-042 Being a By-law to amend Trespass By-law 19-075
23-043 Being a by-law to confirm the proceedings of Council at its special meeting held on March 13, 2023.
That this meeting adjourn at 9:40 p.m.
